page.title: 04 The Edme Maltings
page.content: { }The Edme{Maltings Industry}in Mistley has been going for 101 years. The Edme make syrup for cereals and {beer.}The syrup is made out of wheat and barley which is grown in East Anglia. They squash the wheat and barley then boil it and then get rid of the water by evaporation. The syrup is put into tins or taken on lorries to other factories. The tins go on a conveyor belt and have their lids put on by a machine. Then they go under the road where they have their labels stuck on. Finally the cans are put onto lorries and {exported}to the Far East, Middle East, Canada and America. Edme make about 5000 beer and lager kits a day that is 1,825,000 a year. The left overs go to farm animals for food.
